etymologies: mid 16th century (denoting a marginal reference to a passage of text): from medieval Latin quotatio(n-), from the verb quotare (see quote)

definitions: a group of words taken from a text or speech and repeated by someone other than the original author or speaker
shortDefinitions: group of words taken from text or speech

definitions: a short musical passage or visual image taken from one piece of music or work of art and used in another

examples.text: a quotation from Bartók's Fourth String Quartet

shortDefinitions: short musical passage or visual image taken from one piece of music or work of art

definitions: the action of quoting from a text, speech, piece of music, or work of art

examples.text: a great argument with much quotation of Darwin

shortDefinitions: action of quoting from text, speech, piece of music

definitions: a formal statement setting out the estimated cost for a particular job or service

examples.text: you will be sent a written quotation for the cost of repairing your machine

shortDefinitions: formal statement setting out estimated cost

definitions: a price offered by a broker for the sale or purchase of a stock or other security.
shortDefinitions: price offered by market-maker for sale or purchase of stock

definitions: a registration granted to a company enabling their shares to be officially listed and traded

examples.text: the company is being refused a quotation on the New York Stock Exchange

shortDefinitions: registration granted to company enabling their shares to be officially listed and traded
